lead_paragraph: The spouses of two South Sudanese rivals accused by the United Nations of using sexual violence as a war tactic are participating in a United Nations panel.

headline.print_headline: Peace Event Hosts Wives of Leaders Tied to Rape
headline.main: Peace Event Hosts Wives of South Sudan Leaders Tied to Rape

snippet: The spouses of two South Sudanese rivals accused by the United Nations of using sexual violence as a war tactic are participating in a United Nations panel.
abstract: Human rights advocates blast United Nations panel promoting gender equity for hosting Mary Ayen Mayardit and Angelina Teny, wives of South Sudanese Pres Salva Kiir and his rival, Riek Machar, respectively;  critics cite UN report accusing Kiir's forces of systematically using sexual violence to terrorize civilians; report also levied similar accusations against forces loyal to Machar.
